Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Solver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PBSolver, ProbabilitySolver, SinglePointSolver

    public abstract class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class for a board solver. Contains many helper methods.
    Since:
    2019-03-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Bradley Read

    • Constructor Detail

      • Solver

        public Solver(Minesweeper game)
        Constructor for solver. Using this constructor means that the solver can not be stopped.
        Parameters:
        game - the game that the solver is going to perform moves on.

      • Solver

        public Solver(Minesweeper game,
              java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean running)
        Constuctor for sovler. The solver can be stopped by changing the passed running boolean to false.
        Parameters:
        game - the game that the solver is going to perform moves on.
        running - the value that controls whether the solver should continue/stop solving.

    • Method Detail

      • hint

        public abstract boolean hint()
        Highlights a safe/recommended move to the user.
        Returns:
        True if a hint (one that has not already been hinted) is found. False if no hint or futher hints are found.

      • assist

        public abstract boolean assist()
        Probe a safe/recommended cell.
        Returns:
        True if a cell is found and probed. False if no safe cell is found and probed.

      • solve

        public abstract void solve()
        Probe all safe/recommended cells present on the board. Stop when no more safe/recommended moves can be found. Basically repeatably calls the assist method.

      • getFirstGuess

        public Cell getFirstGuess()
        Return the cell on the board that has the best probability of revealing an opening. Calculations can be found at "http://datagenetics.com/blog/june12012/index.html". Order of Logic: Corner cell, else edge cell, else centre cell.
        Returns:
        Cell that has best chance of revealing an opening (a cell with number 0).

      • makeFirstGuess

        public boolean makeFirstGuess()
        Probe the cell with best best probability of revealing an opening. See getFirstGuess().
        Returns:
        True if an opening was found or if an opening has previously been found. False if no opening was found.

      • makeFirstGuessCorner

        public boolean makeFirstGuessCorner()
        Probe a corner cell. Intended to be used when performing simulations.
        Returns:
        True if a corner cell is probed and revealed an opening (a cell with number 0). False otherwise.

      • makeFirstGuessEdge

        public boolean makeFirstGuessEdge()
        Probe an edge cell. Intended to be used when performing simulations.
        Returns:
        True if an edge cell is probed and revealed an opening (a cell with number 0). False otherwise.

      • makeFirstGuessCentre

        public boolean makeFirstGuessCentre()
        Probe an centre cell. Intended to be used when performing simulations.
        Returns:
        True if an centre cell is probed and revealed an opening (a cell with number 0). False otherwise.

      • getClosedCentreCells

        private java.util.List<Cell> getClosedCentreCells()
        Get a list of all closed centre cells. Note: a centre cell is a cell that does not touch any of the edges of the board.
        Returns:
        a list of all closed centre cells.

      • getClosedCornerCells

        private java.util.List<Cell> getClosedCornerCells()
        Get a list of all closed corner cells.
        Returns:
        a list of all the closed corner cells.

      • getClosedEdgeCells

        public java.util.List<Cell> getClosedEdgeCells()
        Get a list of all closed edge cells. Note: an edge cell is a cell that is on the border of the board. DOES NOT INCLUDE CORNER CELLS.
        Returns:
        a list of all the closed edge cells.

      • encodeCellId

        protected int encodeCellId(Cell c)
        When passed a cell and a board, create a unique identifier (a single integer) for that cell. To be used for creating litrals
        Parameters:
        c - Cell to encode.
        board - Board the cell is present in, used to get the width of the board.
        Returns:
        Unique integer identifier for given cell.

      • decodeCellId

        public Cell decodeCellId(int id)
        When passed an identity, decode and return the cell it is referring to.
        Parameters:
        id - Unique encoded identity id.
        board - Board the cell would be present in, used to get the width of the board.
        Returns:
        Cell that the id refers to.

      • encodeLit

        protected int encodeLit(int i)
        Encodes a literal so that it does not colide with any cell literals.
        Parameters:
        i - the ith literal wanting to be encoded.
        Returns:
        an encoded literal.

      • decodeLit

        private Cell decodeLit(int lit)

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.List<Cell> getNeighbours(Cell cell)
        Return the neighbouring cells around a cell.
        Parameters:
        cell - the cell whoses neighbours will be returned.
        Returns:
        a list of the neighbouring cells of the passed cell.

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.List<Cell> getNeighbours(int x,
                                          int y)
        Return the neighbouring cells around a cell.
        Parameters:
        x - the cell's X coord whoses neighbours will be returned.
        y - the cell's Y coord whoses neighbours will be returned.]
        Returns:
        a list of the neighbouring cells of the passed cell.

      • getLandCells

        public java.util.List<Cell> getLandCells()
        Return a list of all the games land cells. Note: a land cell is a cell that has been probed (is open).
        Returns:
        a list of cells that are classed as land cells.

      • getSeaCells

        public java.util.List<Cell> getSeaCells()
        Return a list of all the games sea cells. Note: a sea cell is a cell that has not been probed and does not touch an open cell.
        Returns:
        a list of cells that are classed as sea cells.

      • getClosedShoreCells

        public java.util.List<Cell> getClosedShoreCells()
        Return a list of all the games closed shore cells. Note: a "closed" shore cell is a cell that has not been probed (is closed) and touches both a land cell and a sea cell.
        Returns:
        a list of cells that are classed as closed shore cells.

      • getOpenShoreCells

        public java.util.List<Cell> getOpenShoreCells()
        Return a list of all the games open sore cells. Note: a "open" shore cell is a cell that has has been probed (is open) and touches a closed cell.
        Returns:
        a list of cells that are classsed as open shore cells.

      • calcFlaggedNeighbours

        public int calcFlaggedNeighbours(int x,
                                 int y)
        Count the amount of flagged cells are around a cell.
        Parameters:
        x - X-axis coordinate of cell.
        y - Y-axis coordinate of cell.
        Returns:
        the number of flagged neighbouring cells.

      • calcClosedNeighbours

        public int calcClosedNeighbours(int x,
                                int y)
        Count the amount of closed cells are around a cell.
        Parameters:
        x - X-axis coordinate of cell.
        y - Y-axis coordinate of cell.
        Returns:
        the number of closed neighbouring cells.

      • setQuiet

        public void setQuiet(boolean quiet)

      • probeRandomCell

        public void probeRandomCell()
        Probe a random cell on the board.

      • getRandomCell

        public Cell getRandomCell(java.util.List<Cell> cellList)
        Get a random cell from a list of cells. Returns null if passed cellList if empty.
        Parameters:
        cellList - the list of cells the select a random cell from.
        Returns:
        a random cell. Returns null if passed cellList if empty.

      • stopSolver

        public void stopSolver()
